summary: SummaryJuvia's Place Blushed Liquid Blush is a lightweight multi-use liquid blush that creates effortless radiance and a dewy finish on cheeks.
details: DetailsBenefitsHighly blendable, this pigmented creamy formula hydrates the skin with vitamin E for a natural looking glow.Item 2609909How To UseApply to the cheek bones, to add a flush of color and create natural, all-day dewy looks.IngredientsHydrogenated Polyisobutene, Mica, Isododecane, Ethylene/Propylene/Styrene Copolymer, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Disteardimonium Hectorite, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, Propylene Carbonate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Butylene/Ethylene/Styrene Copolymer, Tocopheryl Acetate, Bht, TocopherolMay Contain: Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Yellow 5 Lake (CI 19140), Red 6 Lake (CI 15850), Red 7 Lake (CI 15850), Iron Oxides (CI 77499), Iron Oxide (Ci77491), Iron Oxide (CI 77492), Blue 1 Lake (CI 42090), Red 28 Lake (CI 45410)
how_to_use: Apply to the cheek bones, to add a flush of color and create natural, all-day dewy looks.

reviews.headline: Little Goes a Long Way
reviews.comments: Beautiful color for medium/deep skin. I looked everywhere for a warm red blush. Love this and used it for my wedding. The review that said a ballpoint pen dot is enough is right! Try on back of hand or palette first. Long-lasting and rich.

reviews.headline: Nice
reviews.comments: Color last all day

reviews.headline: HOLY GRAIL
reviews.comments: Best blush everüëÖüëÖ

reviews.headline: LOVE!
reviews.comments: I have dry skin, my makeup products need to be liquid.  I love the high pigmented colors.  I purchased, Pink Lady Glow; It's has a youthful radiance and sparkles. It looks beautiful on my fair/medium skin tone.  A itty-bitty dot goes a long ways.

reviews.headline: Obsessed
reviews.comments: I never go with such a pink blush, but as of this summer i have switched it up ans been obsessed

reviews.headline: Love Love Loveeee!!!
reviews.comments: My skin color is pretty dark so people always tell me you should like use a dark purple shade blush and I thought about it and I now bought it and it's pretty and gorgeous!!! Do recommend for my dark skin girlies!üíï

reviews.headline: Will last for years
reviews.comments: A dot goes a long way. Seriously ! Its very pigmented and bright u just need a dot to color your cheeks

reviews.headline: Favorite Blush!

reviews.headline: It will last a while
reviews.comments: I got this in two shades- Barbie Rose super pigmented have to be very careful or I'll look like a clown and I believe Pink Lady not sure but just the perfect flush look to replace my UD discontinued liquid blush

reviews.headline: so pigmented
reviews.comments: dupe for rare beauty. these are so pigmented - the tiniest dot goes so far (a little too far lol). the formula and dry down is beautiful. very flexible and easy to blend.

reviews.headline: I was surprised how well this lasted throughout day.
reviews.comments: Application was easy and color was beautiful.  Surprisingly good quality.

reviews.headline: Strong color
reviews.comments: Pretty and strong color.  Worth it for the price.

reviews.headline: Pros and cons
reviews.comments: this product is good. it's long lasting, although it stains your face and if you leave a dot of blush to blend it out later it stains in that shape too. the best thing about this product is you wont run out so quickly because of how little you need. Great for all skintones
Most pigmented, affordable blushes. Blends so easily and colors are beautiful.

reviews.headline: Best liquid blush
reviews.comments: Large color payoff for only a little product! I love this liquid blush. It lasts all day and the colors are beautiful!

faceoff_positive.comments:
I'm going to review the actual product before I go into detail on the issues I had, to spare those only wanting to know about performance the time reading everything. 

It's definitely an over-performer. The pigment is ridiculous (in the best way). While I've seen certain influencers speak on over-pigment, that's only coming from people who are lacking pigment of their own (I mean that in the nicest way possible). As a pale person that does makeup primarily on my friends, their family, my daughter, her friends, etc. most of which are beautiful people with various shades of brown skin;  I can say with confidence that the extra pigment was a welcomed change in my collection. 

I definitely only apply it one cheek at a time because it dries down quick and makes blending difficult and gets patchy. I've had no issues blending with a brush, sponge or fingers. I like to use an electronic mister on my brush which makes blending completely effortless (dollar tree, yall, get it). I don't see any cons. I don't even mind that stealthy $2 price increase a couple weeks after launch (hey, get that money). 

However, I did have an issue! 
I received a few of these as an early Mother's Day gift from a friend that knows I collect blush like I know she collects lip products. I saw the launch email and was thrilled to see what I THOUGHT was a lavender blush, so I grabbed a screenshot and texted it to her and she responded with a screenshot of what she wanted. 

About 30 minutes later she says she can't find the color in the advertisement, so I forward the email thinking maybe our identical iPhone 14s mysteriously have different color settings. She says she sees it's lavender in the ad but it's not on the website. 

This turns into an hour-long hysterical process where we're using pens and paper physically matching colors on the website to the email image. We agree on the shade Soft Tulip. I also got Marigold and Sweet Berries (love them). 

It's not lavender. It's pink, definitely in the bubblegum family which I have no shortage of. I was disappointed more than anything because there's no shortage of bubble gum pinks, but nude mauves and spicy browns, lavenders and purples, corals and oranges, fuchsias and reds are always neglected. 

I was thrilled to see the spiced tones for this drop and they're gorgeous! Alas, I'm still on my hunt/wait for lavender. ü§ß
faceoff_positive.headline: Gorgeous but I wish it had the colors in the ad!

faceoff_negative.comments:
Will be returning. Shade: Soft Tulip
1. The color is way DARKER IN PERSON. The photos are very inaccurate. It is described as "Soft Pops of Peach" but it VERY RED. Looks nothing like the photo. I thought I was getting one of the lightest shades and it is way too dark.
2. It STAINS! very pigmented. too much pigment that it actually stained my skin.
3. The APPLICATOR pulls out too much product. It is similar, if not the same, applicator as their concealer. which I had the same issue. It pulled out so much product that it becomes messy and gets all over the rim of the container. For how pigmented this is, it should not pull out this much product.
4. Difficult to blend.

5. Final Notes:
If you have lighter complexion like me, don't even bother with this brand. I wanted to support a black owned business but it's not for me I guess. The company claims "Our customers are women. Our customers are men. Our customers have skin tones in the fairest fairs to the deepest darks. The Juvia's Tribe is where we celebrate our customers that come to us from all walks of life." For a company that was founded to be inclusive for all skin tones. It's not. The company is catered towards darker complexion and neglects to be inclusive to all people. I just think it's pretty hypocritical. I'm giving it 2 stars instead of 1 just because I can see it would work better for darker skin tones.
faceoff_negative.headline: Returning
